title: How to Make a Cat or Dog Bed Using a Pillowcase

steps.headline: Stuff an old pillowcase with a soft, warm material.
steps.description: The most ideal options are blankets or feathers. Make sure they are not dirty or touched by another animal.

steps.headline: Make the pillowcase plump by spreading the stuffing around, so no areas are filled with a huge amount.
steps.description: This is important so that your pet is happy with the bed.

steps.headline: Get a duvet cover.
steps.description: Every two centimeters, make small cuts to it. Repeat this process all the way around the edge of the cover. This goes on top of the cushion.

steps.headline: Hide a few pieces of your pet's favorite food at the edge of the pillowcase.
steps.description: Do this so your pet can see only the edges. This will attract him or her to the bed.

steps.headline: Think about where you put the bed.
steps.description: It is best surrounded by your pet's scratch post and toys, but try and keep all your pet's favorite toys close to the position that they were in before.

steps.headline: Get your pet used to the room that it's going to sleep in.
steps.description: Try to play with it and feed it in that room. That way, it will get familiar with its sleeping conditions.

methods.name: Giving Your Pet the Right Sleeping Conditions

steps.headline: Clean the room and keep it hygienic.
steps.description: The room should not be full of mud and dirt, as your cat can get ill from parasites and flies attracted to the dirt.

steps.headline: Turn the lights off at night.
steps.description: Animals are known to sleep very well, but even so, they sleep better when there is no activity or light.

steps.headline: Take your pet to a vet if it has trouble sleeping.
steps.description: He or she should be able to make him/herself fall asleep.

text: Preparing the Pillow Case Stuff an old pillowcase with a soft, warm material. The most ideal options are blankets or feathers. Make sure they are not dirty or touched by another animal. Make the pillowcase plump by spreading the stuffing around, so no areas are filled with a huge amount. This is important so that your pet is happy with the bed. Get a duvet cover. Every two centimeters, make small cuts to it. Repeat this process all the way around the edge of the cover. This goes on top of the cushion. Making the Bed Fun Hide a few pieces of your pet's favorite food at the edge of the pillowcase. Do this so your pet can see only the edges. This will attract him or her to the bed. Think about where you put the bed. It is best surrounded by your pet's scratch post and toys, but try and keep all your pet's favorite toys close to the position that they were in before. Get your pet used to the room that it's going to sleep in. Try to play with it and feed it in that room. That way, it will get familiar with its sleeping conditions. Giving Your Pet the Right Sleeping Conditions Clean the room and keep it hygienic. The room should not be full of mud and dirt, as your cat can get ill from parasites and flies attracted to the dirt. Turn the lights off at night. Animals are known to sleep very well, but even so, they sleep better when there is no activity or light. Take your pet to a vet if it has trouble sleeping. He or she should be able to make him/herself fall asleep.
